Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Electrostimulation in Dysvascular Amputees

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive electrostimulation of the gastrocnemius muscle plus standard rehabilitation or standard rehabilitation alone.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive electrostimulation of the gastrocnemius muscle plus standard rehabilitation or standard rehabilitation alone.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates non-surgical interventions to prevent CLL tissue loss and amputation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of new major amputation of the CLL over 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was by birthdate, with unclear allocation concealment.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Electrostimulation was associated with a three-fold reduction in the incidence of new major amputation of the CLL (RR 0.33, 95% CI 0.04 to 2.99).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events and hospital readmissions were not reported.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration: Protocol available via DOI 10.1002/14651858.CD013857
